items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, Monday 3 November.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels will remain high over the next couple of days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Tuesday 4 November 2025, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: County Durham, Darlington, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.  
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
Forecast high river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from the early hours of 03 November 2025 through to Tuesday 4 November. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Further rain throughout Monday, 3rd of November will cause the rivers to remain high and peak early evening on Monday. We are not currently forecasting any property flooding. 

We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue flood warnings if required. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 5:A00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 03 November 2025 . 
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:-  Llanymynech 3.3m to 3.6m on 04/11 PM. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 8:00AM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Lancashire, North Yorkshire, Westmorland and Furness

items.message:
Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 04 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the river Lune, Conder and Keer and other watercourses from Kirkby Lonsdale to Galgate including Gressingham, Carnforth, Hornby, Wray, Bentham and Lancaster. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens and closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, Monday 03/11/2025, between now and 12:00pm. Locations most affected will be areas surrounding Widdale Beck near the A684, and Brunt Acres Road north of Hawes. We are closely monitoring the situation. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have. This message will be updated by 08:00pm or if things change.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 03 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Further rain across today, Monday 3 November and Tuesday 4 November will lead to increased river levels which will peak on Tuesday. There is currently uncertainty in the band of rain which will pass across Cumbria on Monday evening and into Tuesday. If it does pass over south Cumbria then it has the potential to cause property flooding in Kendal on Tuesday. We will monitor this situation and issue flood warnings if required. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 04 November 2025. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the rivers Wyre, Calder and Brock and other watercourses from Abbeystead to Catterall including Scorton, Garstang, Bilsborrow, Ainspool and Churchtown. 
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and closely monitoring the situation. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Forecast high river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible from the early hours of 03 November 2025 into Tuesday 04 November. 

Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Further rain throughout Monday, 3rd of November will cause the rivers to remain high and peak on Tuesday. There is the potential for a heavy band of rain to come through on Tuesday evening which has the potential to cause property flooding. We are closely monitoring the situation .and will issue flood warnings if required 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
High river levels today has led to flooding. 
Flooding is possible on 03 November 2025 and the 04 November. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. Another heavy band of rain is coming across the catchment from this evening, Monday 3 of November. This will cause levels to rise further and could result in us issuing further flood warnings. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 03 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 04 November 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near to the rivers Ribble, Hodder and other watercourses, from Settle to Samlesbury including Clitheroe, Gisburn, Sawley, Waddington and Ribchester. 
We are clearing blockages from debris screens closely monitoring the situation. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 04 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
